intro: Brachystelma gondwanense, commonly known as the Gondwana stonecrop, is a succulent plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Aizoaceae, which is characterized by its fleshy leaves and showy flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments. Its leaves are thick and fleshy, storing water to help it survive in dry conditions. The flowers, which are usually pink or purple, bloom in summer and attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
